summary: This is a standard U.S. Attorney's Office form requesting travel arrangements for a fact witness to appear in the Southern District of New York for the trial and trial preparation in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The witness's personal details are not filled in, and the form includes standard instructions for witness travel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case referenced in the travel request form (United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell).

persons.name: Ed Tyrrell
persons.context: Mentioned in the form's instructions as a contact for questions about witness travel funding from litigative funds for investigative interviews.

events.title: Witness Travel Request Issued
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney (AUSA) submits a domestic witness travel request form to the SDNY Victim/Witness Unit for an unnamed fact witness needed for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial.

keyFacts: The document is a travel request form for a fact witness to testify or prepare for testimony in the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell (Docket No. 20 Cr. 330).
The witness's identity, date of birth, address, and contact information are not provided in this copy of the form, indicating it is a blank or partially completed template.
The form specifies the witness is needed for both 'Trial' and 'Trial Prep,' and is a 'Fact Witness' and not an 'Expert Witness.'
The form references standard DOJ instructions (DOJ Instruction 1300.01.01) and procedures for funding witness travel, distinguishing between grand jury/court testimony and investigative interviews.
The document is part of the routine administrative process of the U.S. justice system for managing witness logistics in a high-profile case.
